input.content:
# ScopeLock Strategic Roadmap

**Last Updated:** 2025-11-05

---

## Current Phase: AI-Assisted Development Model

**Timeline:** 2025-11-01 ‚Üí 2025-12-31 (2 months)
**Focus:** Prove AI-assisted junior developer model can deliver quality at speed

**Metrics:**
- Proposals sent: Current 0, Target 20/week by end of phase
- Win rate: Current 0%, Target 25% (5 jobs/week won)
- Missions delivered: Current 0, Target 8 in phase (4/month)
- Revenue: Current ‚Ç¨0, Target ‚Ç¨40K in phase
- Profit margin: Target 50%+ (‚Ç¨20K net)
- Runway: Target 6+ months by end of phase

---

## Phase 1: Solo Founder (Past)

**Timeline:** 2024-01 ‚Üí 2025-10
**Focus:** High-value complex missions, Nicolas solo

- ‚úÖ Built La Serenissima (97 agents, 99.7% uptime)
- ‚úÖ Built TherapyKin (121+ deployments)
- ‚úÖ Built KinKong ($75k$ AUM trading bot)
- ‚úÖ Established ScopeLock methodology (AC Green, Evidence Sprint, Proof Log)

**Outcomes:**
- Proven technical depth
- Portfolio with social proof (Terminal Velocity 1.1k stars)
- ScopeLock framework validated
- Revenue: High per-mission (‚Ç¨5-10K), low volume (1-2/month)

**Lesson:** Not scalable solo. Need team to increase volume.

---

## Phase 2: AI-Assisted Development Model (Current)

**Timeline:** 2025-11-01 ‚Üí 2025-12-31
**Status:** In Progress (Week 1)

**Goals:**
- [ ] Hire 2-3 junior developers (Nigeria/C√¥te d'Ivoire)
- [ ] Deliver 8 missions using AI-generated code + human supervision
- [ ] Achieve 25% proposal win rate (5/week won from 20/week sent)
- [ ] Maintain 50%+ profit margin
- [ ] Build 6 months runway

**Success criteria:**
- Junior developers can deploy AI-generated code independently after 3 missions
- Client satisfaction remains high (no complaints, payment at AC Green)
- Quality maintained (Sofia QA pass rate >90%)
- Proposal ‚Üí delivery time <2 weeks average

**Current Status (2025-11-05):**
- Team structure defined ‚úÖ
- AI citizens created (Emma, Inna, Rafael, Sofia, Alexis, Maya) ‚úÖ
- Standard tech stack defined (Next.js + Vercel, Python + Render) ‚úÖ
- First developer (Reanance) onboarding ‚è≥
- First proposals: 0 sent (Emma needs activation)

**Blockers:**
- Need to activate Emma to start sending proposals
- Need to hire 1-2 more junior developers
- Need to test full workflow (proposal ‚Üí delivery) at least once

---

## Phase 3: Scale to 5-10 Developers

**Planned start:** 2026-01-01
**Duration:** 3 months

**Prerequisites:**
- Phase 2 goals achieved (8 missions delivered, 50% margin, 6 months runway)
- Workflow proven (proposal ‚Üí Inna ‚Üí Rafael ‚Üí developer ‚Üí Sofia ‚Üí AC Green)
- At least 2 developers performing independently

**Goals:**
- Hire 3-5 more junior developers
- Increase to 10-20 simultaneous missions
- Revenue: ‚Ç¨100K+ per month
- Profit: ‚Ç¨50K+ per month
- Establish lead developer role (promote best performer)

**Success criteria:**
- 10+ simultaneous missions without quality degradation
- Win rate maintained at 25%+
- Profit margin maintained at 50%+
- Developer retention >80% (low turnover)

---

## Phase 4: Market Expansion (Future)

**Planned start:** 2026-04-01

**Prerequisites:**
- 5-10 developers performing well
- Revenue stable at ‚Ç¨100K+/month
- Team management systems proven

**Goals:**
- Expand to new verticals (healthcare, fintech, AI infrastructure)
- Add retainer model (monthly ongoing work)
- Geographic expansion (EU market, US market)
- Partner channel (agencies white-labeling ScopeLock)

**Unknowns to resolve:**
- Which verticals are most profitable?
- Which geographic markets have best demand/price ratio?
- Can we maintain quality at 20+ simultaneous missions?

---

## Future Opportunities (Not Yet Scheduled)

**Service Offerings:**
- Monthly retainers for ongoing development (predictable revenue)
- "Evidence Sprint only" product (‚Ç¨2-3K for demo + delta, no full build)
- White-label ScopeLock for agencies (licensing model)
- AI consulting/training (teach other agencies AI-assisted workflow)

**Market Expansion:**
- Healthcare (HIPAA-compliant, therapy, wellness)
- Fintech (trading, payments, banking)
- AI infrastructure (protocols, frameworks, multi-agent)
- Enterprise automation (internal tools, workflow automation)

**Team Growth:**
- Hire lead developer (supervise 5-10 junior devs)
- Hire client success manager (Maya role, human)
- Add specialized developers (mobile, blockchain, ML)

**Technology:**
- Build internal ScopeLock platform (automate Inna specs, Rafael code gen, Sofia QA)
- Contribute to open source (Terminal Velocity, Mind Protocol)
- Build public API for ScopeLock methodology (other agencies can integrate)

---

## Strategic Principles (Constant Across All Phases)

1. **Quality over volume:** AC Green is non-negotiable, never ship broken code
2. **AI does heavy lifting, humans supervise:** 95% AI work, 5% human review
3. **Transparent pricing:** Scope locked, pay at AC Green, Swap/Add for changes
4. **Proof-driven:** Public proof log, demos, quantified deltas
5. **Sustainable margins:** 50%+ profit margin, never race to bottom on price
6. **Developer empowerment:** Junior devs learn and grow, not just code monkeys
7. **Standard stack:** Next.js + Vercel, Python + Render unless client constraints

---

## Metrics Dashboard (Track Monthly)

**Acquisition (Emma):**
- Proposals sent: [current]
- Win rate: [current %]
- Response time: [median minutes]

**Delivery (Developers + Rafael):**
- Missions in progress: [current]
- Missions delivered: [this month]
- Average delivery time: [days from won ‚Üí AC Green]

**Quality (Sofia):**
- QA pass rate: [% first time]
- Bugs found: [count]
- Client complaints: [count]

**Financial (Alexis):**
- Revenue won: ‚Ç¨[X]
- Revenue delivered: ‚Ç¨[X]
- Revenue collected: ‚Ç¨[X]
- Costs: ‚Ç¨[X]
- Profit margin: [X]%
- Runway: [X] months

**Team (Alexis):**
- Active developers: [count]
- Developer performance: [list with scores]
- Turnover: [count left this month]

# Strategic Ideas & Improvements

**Last Updated:** 2025-11-05

---

## Pricing Strategy Ideas

**2025-11-05 - Dynamic Pricing Based on Urgency**
- **Problem:** Currently flat pricing regardless of client timeline
- **Idea:** Add urgency premium (+30% for <1 week delivery, +50% for <3 days)
- **Impact:** Higher margins on rush jobs, filters out unreasonable timelines
- **Effort:** Low (just pricing decision, no system changes)
- **Status:** New

**2025-11-05 - Evidence Sprint as Standalone Product**
- **Problem:** Some clients want to "try before commit" but Evidence Sprint is bundled
- **Idea:** Offer Evidence Sprint only (‚Ç¨2-3K) with option to continue to full AC Green
- **Impact:** Lower barrier to entry, converts skeptical clients, recurring revenue if they continue
- **Effort:** Low (just pricing + proposal templates)
- **Status:** New

**2025-11-05 - Retainer Model for Ongoing Work**
- **Problem:** One-time missions = unpredictable revenue
- **Idea:** Offer monthly retainer (‚Ç¨5-10K/month) for ongoing feature development
- **Impact:** Predictable revenue, stable cash flow, long-term client relationships
- **Effort:** Medium (need retainer contract template, monthly planning process)
- **Status:** New

---

## Team Management Ideas

**2025-11-05 - Performance-Based Pay Increases**
- **Problem:** Flat $6-8/hour doesn't reward high performers
- **Idea:** Start at $6/hour, increase to $8 after 3 successful missions, $10 after 6 months if quality high
- **Impact:** Retention of best developers, motivation to deliver quality
- **Effort:** Low (just compensation decision)
- **Status:** New

**2025-11-05 - Lead Developer Role**
- **Problem:** Nicolas can't supervise 10+ junior devs alone
- **Idea:** Promote best performer to "lead dev" role (supervise 5 juniors, $15-20/hour)
- **Impact:** Scalability, mentorship, career growth for developers
- **Effort:** Medium (need to define role, responsibilities, training)
- **Status:** New (wait until Phase 3)

**2025-11-05 - Weekly Team Call (Optional)**
- **Problem:** Remote team may feel isolated
- **Idea:** Optional 30-min weekly team call (show what you built this week, Q&A)
- **Impact:** Team bonding, knowledge sharing, motivation
- **Effort:** Low (just calendar invite)
- **Status:** New

---

## Financial Tracking Ideas

**2025-11-05 - Weekly Financial Dashboard Automation**
- **Problem:** Manually tracking revenue/costs is time-consuming
- **Idea:** Build simple dashboard (Airtable or Google Sheet) with auto-updated metrics
- **Impact:** Real-time visibility, faster decision-making
- **Effort:** Medium (1-2 days to build)
- **Status:** New

**2025-11-05 - Cash Flow Alert System**
- **Problem:** Might not notice runway issues until too late
- **Idea:** Automatic alerts when runway <3 months or net margin <30%
- **Impact:** Proactive risk management, avoid cash crunches
- **Effort:** Low (just conditional email/Slack notification)
- **Status:** New

---

## Branding Ideas

**2025-11-05 - "Built with ScopeLock" Badge**
- **Problem:** Clients don't promote their projects publicly (no word-of-mouth)
- **Idea:** Offer "Built with ScopeLock" badge for client websites (links back to scopelock.mindprotocol.ai)
- **Impact:** SEO backlinks, social proof, passive lead generation
- **Effort:** Low (design badge, add to handoff)
- **Status:** New

**2025-11-05 - Case Study Videos (Not Just Text)**
- **Problem:** Text case studies are good, but video is more engaging
- **Idea:** Record 2-3 minute walkthrough videos for La Serenissima, TherapyKin (show actual product)
- **Impact:** Higher engagement, better conversion on portfolio page
- **Effort:** Medium (1 day to record + edit)
- **Status:** New

**2025-11-05 - Client Testimonials Program**
- **Problem:** No client testimonials on website (trust signal missing)
- **Idea:** Request testimonial at post-delivery check-in, offer ‚Ç¨100 discount on next project
- **Impact:** Social proof, higher proposal win rate
- **Effort:** Low (just add to Maya's post-delivery checklist)
- **Status:** New

---

## Operations Ideas

**2025-11-05 - Onboarding Checklist for New Developers**
- **Problem:** No standardized onboarding, each developer gets different intro
- **Idea:** Create 1-page onboarding checklist (accounts, tools, first mission walkthrough)
- **Impact:** Faster time-to-productivity, consistent experience
- **Effort:** Low (1 hour to write)
- **Status:** New

**2025-11-05 - ScopeLock Internal Platform (Long-term)**
- **Problem:** Inna docs, Rafael code gen, Sofia QA are all manual (Claude Code sessions)
- **Idea:** Build internal platform that automates: Inna spec generation, Rafael code scaffolding, Sofia test running
- **Impact:** 10x faster delivery, lower cost per mission
- **Effort:** High (months of development)
- **Status:** New (Phase 4 or later)

**2025-11-05 - Standard Mission Templates**
- **Problem:** Every mission starts from scratch (Inna writes AC.md, Rafael sets up repo, etc.)
- **Idea:** Create templates for common patterns (Next.js + Airtable, Next.js + PostgreSQL + Python API)
- **Impact:** Faster delivery, fewer mistakes, easier for junior devs
- **Effort:** Medium (1-2 days per template)
- **Status:** New

---

## Marketing/Lead Generation Ideas

**2025-11-05 - Emma Auto-Sends GO Proposals (Optional)**
- **Problem:** Human has to manually copy-paste every proposal (bottleneck)
- **Idea:** Give Emma API access to auto-send GO proposals (with human approval via Telegram)
- **Impact:** 10x proposal volume (from 5/day to 50/day)
- **Effort:** Medium (need Upwork API integration + approval flow)
- **Status:** New (risky, need to test carefully)

**2025-11-05 - Blog Content SEO Strategy**
- **Problem:** ScopeLock website has no blog traffic (no inbound leads)
- **Idea:** Publish 1 blog post/week on AI-assisted development, case studies, methodology
- **Impact:** Organic traffic, inbound leads, thought leadership
- **Effort:** Medium (2-3 hours/week to write + publish)
- **Status:** New

**2025-11-05 - LinkedIn Outreach (Not Just Upwork)**
- **Problem:** 100% dependent on Upwork (single platform risk)
- **Idea:** Emma also finds leads on LinkedIn (CTOs posting about needing help)
- **Impact:** Diversified lead sources, potentially higher-budget clients
- **Effort:** Low (Emma just searches LinkedIn too)
- **Status:** New

---

## Notes

- Ideas are cheap, execution is hard‚Äîprioritize based on impact/effort
- Test ideas as experiments (not commitments)
- Measure results, kill ideas that don't work
- Steal good ideas from competitors/agencies

# Strategic Action Items

**Last Updated:** 2025-11-05

---

## High Priority (This Week)

- [ ] Update Emma's CLAUDE.md with Marketing/Content responsibilities (by 2025-11-06)
- [ ] Update Rafael's CLAUDE.md with DevOps support responsibilities (by 2025-11-06)
- [ ] Add Maya to main CLAUDE.md team structure section (by 2025-11-06)

---

## Medium Priority (This Month)

- [ ] Set up monthly financial tracking template (Airtable or Google Sheet)
- [ ] Create developer onboarding checklist (1 page, ready for first hire)
- [ ] Review runway projections (current cash, monthly burn rate)

---

## Low Priority (Backlog)

- [ ] Design "Built with ScopeLock" badge
- [ ] Draft client testimonial request template (for Maya to use)
- [ ] Research retainer pricing models (compare to competitors)
- [ ] Explore Upwork API for Emma auto-send proposals (feasibility check)

---

## Completed (Recent)

**2025-11-05**
- ‚úÖ Created Maya "The Bridge" citizen (Client Success Manager)
- ‚úÖ Defined Maya's responsibilities (onboarding, status updates, change requests, handoff)
- ‚úÖ Added strategic tracking system to Alexis CLAUDE.md
